pic1_alt: A data poster by W.E.B Du Bois from the 1900 Paris Exposition. The poster is in English and French, entitled A Series Of Statistical Charts Illustrating The Conditions Of Descendants Of Formal African Slaves Now Resident In The Unites States. It shows a map of the United States. In the center is a large pie chart showing the distribution of professions of negro graduates of Atlanta University: 58.5% teachers, 28.1% house wives, 4.3% ministers, 3.2% government service, 2.1% business, and 3.8% other professions.
pic2_alt: A poster for the overall Du Bois Challenge 2024. Bars show the colors of the Pan African Flag: red, black, and green. The 10 weeks of the challenge are divided into red, black, and green rows. Week 10 is off to the side as a combination of colors.
